column4: ok if i ll ask 3 good questions , am i then worthy of private discussion?
why has ubuntu better mono support than debian?
it doesn't
sure, just like Debian does
same as on any other linux OS; it depends on what tool you use
please stop trying to weasel out of the channe, it's really quite annoying
how is asking question here "spam"?
no, it's not
if you have trouble following, then you need to read faster or filter out things you don't care about it
plug it in
a window  will pop up; drag stuff to it, select burn, all done

the file manager is a perfectly good dvd burner
: does it support UDF?
yes
there's obviously no "best"
even if you install and use gnome, there's no "config tool to find new HW"
hotplug will load modules for most everything automatically
what gui does hotplug require? how do i use it?
there's no gui
it loads modules automatically
no gui, ... i see the fun with linux starts & end with the prompt.. ;)
there's nothing to do
the module gets loaded, software can start using the hardware
what would you want the gui to do?
build-essential
presumably you want mozilla-browser
i want mozilla firefox and remove the rest
is this possible?
yes, run the command I gave you
mozilla is removed it did work!

then you shouldn't be using apt-get
, what i should be using then?
aptitude or synaptic

sudo aptitude
nope
ther is still a swap file of the txt file present... any chance?
copy the swap file, now
where to?
er, anywhere?

dont focus on that

yes...not really readble text...strange characters... :(
plz my swap file is stilll...a swap file and not a text tifle..
that's great
it sounds like your file is gone, sadly
failure is not an option!
failure is not an option! ;)
good luck then
, ...thx ur beeing...cheerful

doubt it
does the "java" command do something?

but that mode said , 1 Block could not be read.. how do i avoid this block?
I said above I have no idea
that's not your real question, tell us what you're trying to do
i tried to install icecc a control center for icewm but then it said: icecc: error while loading shared libraries: libqt-mt.so.3: cannot open shared object file: No such file or directory
packages.ubuntu.com will tell you what file that is in
hint: libqt3c102-mt
ur speaking not "easy" engough to me
is this " libqt3c102-mt" a pkg i need to install via apt-get?
indeed
because it doesn't contain that file
ok i try now ur search suggest
im too clumsy for that search engine :/ is this my keyword:   libqt-mt.so.3 ..?
yes
but the search string must be incomplete it didn't find anything what else do i have to specify??
scroll down. you want the package contents search page
there was 2 results, showing the file and 2 diffrent paths...what now?
it told you the package name to install

you've really never installed a package on ubuntu before?
, only with apt-get?
then use apt-get
